basics.name: Daniel Viaño Castro
basics.label: Senior Software Engineer
basics.summary: Senior C++ Software Engineer specializing in aerospace, air traffic management, and embedded systems. Delivers robust, high‑performance solutions for mission‑critical applications with a strong background in system integration and modern software practices. Proven track record across defense, surveying, and advanced imaging systems.

work.name: Darwin Recruitment
work.summary: Embedded Software Engineer at Hexagon Productization Center, developing hybrid airborne sensor systems for advanced imaging and data acquisition.
highlights: Developed the MultiMapper hybrid sensor system integrating 11 RGB and 2 NIR cameras with LiDAR to simultaneously collect multi‑spectral imagery and 3D point clouds for large‑area mapping, achieving superior data consistency through advanced sensor synchronization

Developed camera firmware (image acquisition and processing algorithms) for 11 RGB and 2 NIR cameras, ensuring precise time synchronization to deliver reliable raw and processed TIFF images for multi‑spectral mapping, using C++

Developed LiDAR firmware including digital signal processing, motor synchronization, and positioning, ensuring precise timing to generate accurate 3D point clouds for terrain modeling and hydrographic mapping, using C++

Performed comprehensive testing and validation of the 20 kg MultiMapper system, ensuring reliable airborne performance via rigorous unit testing (gtest) and integration testing (pytest) on Embedded Linux platforms

Optimized system architecture for Zynq UltraScale+, collaborating with the FPGA team to deliver production‑ready firmware for mission‑critical surveying with improved efficiency and reduced power consumption, using Petalinux SDK

work.name: Akkodis
work.summary: Developed handheld image acquisition devices for SAFRAN Vectronix with emphasis on sensor integration, user interface, testing, and system validation.
highlights: Developed C++ firmware for the Nightwolf multi‑spectral targeting system, enabling situational awareness for special forces via SWIR capabilities that penetrate smoke and haze while achieving ±1.5 m accuracy over a 12 km range, using Qt for the UI on Embedded Linux

Integrated multi‑spectral sensors (daylight, thermal, low light, color CMOS, SWIR) for handheld image acquisition devices, ensuring reliable performance in extreme conditions through comprehensive testing with gtest and Robot Framework
Implemented bidirectional real‑time video streaming and processing using GStreamer
Developed augmented reality widgets to enhance user awareness, delivering advanced visualization using Qt Widgets
Validated functionality across multiple Embedded Linux platforms, delivering production‑ready software for mission‑critical operations using Petalinux SDK and Yocto

work.name: Ad Maiorem Consulting
work.summary: Built and maintained surveillance software for INDRA Air Traffic Control systems, supporting SACTA and iTEC alliance members in mission‑critical environments.
highlights: Maintained and modernized legacy surveillance software in Ada, achieving zero production crashes while delivering new features through systematic refactoring and optimization

Implemented ADS‑B as a new data source, providing more accurate second‑by‑second position data and expanding tracking coverage in non‑radar airspace; reduced ground infrastructure costs by at least 90% versus traditional radar, developing C++ components integrated with the existing Ada codebase
Developed C++ components for new Air Traffic Control systems, achieving 99.9% uptime for safety‑critical operations supporting SACTA and iTEC alliance members through rigorous testing and integration

Ensured reliability in mission‑critical environments, achieving zero production incidents over a 24‑month deployment across multiple European ATC systems via comprehensive testing and proactive monitoring

work.name: Pildo Labs
work.summary: Designed and developed coordination systems for manned and unmanned aircraft, including air navigation and ADS‑B/GNSS acquisition solutions for aerospace initiatives.
highlights: Designed coordination systems for aerial surveillance and firefighting, enabling 24/7 monitoring and extending operations beyond sunset through simultaneous management of manned and unmanned aircraft

Developed airborne navigation and communication software for a 25 kg UAV and manned helicopters, ensuring compliance with DO‑178 and ED‑12 certification standards for autonomous flight operations using C++
Developed ground control station UI compliant with DO‑278 and ED‑109, giving operators a full operational view beyond limited helicopter line‑of‑sight, using C++ and Qt
Integrated ADS‑B, RADAR, and GNSS acquisition solutions, achieving centimeter‑level positioning accuracy for precision aerial operations by combining multiple data sources

work.name: EUROCONTROL
work.summary: Conducted Pan‑European studies on continuous climb/descent operations, managed ADS‑B data, and validated tools and configurations for air traffic research.
highlights: Contributed to the 2018 ECAC‑wide study on continuous climb/descent operations that identified €150M potential annual fuel savings across European airspace by fixing and validating required Java tools
Analyzed a full year of European air traffic ADS‑B data, processing millions of flights to provide actionable insights for Pan‑European optimization studies through advanced filtering and analysis
